title: AI Prototype for Document Classification

problem.description: A law firm received hundreds of documents daily to manually classify into 15 categories. The process was slow, error-prone and created bottlenecks in the workflow.
painPoints: Impossible to scale with increasing volume

constraints.budget: Startup budget, focus on rapid validation
technical: Need for integration with existing document system
compliance: GDPR compliance for sensitive legal data

solution.architecture: FastAPI with ML model (fine-tuned multilingual BERT) for automatic classification. React frontend for human review. Deployed on Railway with automated CI/CD.
keyDecisions: Fine-tuning pre-trained model instead of training from scratch (faster, small dataset)
Human-in-the-loop: AI suggests, human validates (increases trust)
Feature: confidence score for each prediction (transparency)
Complete logging for auditing and continuous improvement
solution.approach: MVP in 3 weeks: week 1 = data prep + baseline model, week 2 = fine-tuning + API, week 3 = frontend + integration + testing with real users.

metrics.label: Classification time
metrics.description: AI classifies automatically, human validates only doubtful cases

metrics.label: Accuracy
metrics.description: Measured on test set of 100 documents

metrics.label: Documents processed
metrics.description: With same team, thanks to automation

results.impact: The firm drastically reduced classification time and can now process 3x more documents with the same team. The system is now being extended to new categories and clients.

role: Team training on usage and maintenance
